page.title: 14Industry and Employment
page.content: Sanquhar, as with other small towns in Britain, is presently suffering from the effects of the recession. The rate of unemployment is 25% and there seems little prospect of improvement. The main employer in the town is a Swedish owned company which produces aluminium extrusions. This company along with an American owned company making carpet tiles stands in an industrial estate provided by the Scottish Developmant Agency. Another large employer is a Canadian owned company producing yarns for carpets, and this company has also received incentives to set up business in the area. Since the closure of the local pits the longest established main employer has been a factory which makes fireworks and military flares. These four companies are at the centre of Sanquhar's economy and its crucial to the town that they succeed.
